required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness and Safety of Restylane Lyft With Lidocaine in the Dorsal Hand
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Evaluator Blinded, Split-hand Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of Restylane Lyft With Lidocaine Compared to no Treatment for Injection in the Dorsal Hand to Correct Volume Deficit

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, evaluator-blind, split hand, multi-center study of the effectiveness and safety or Restylane Lyft with Lidocaine compared to no treatment for injection in the dorsal hand to correct volume deficits.

primary_outcome.measure: Responder Rate Using Validated Hand Grading Scale
primary_outcome.description: A responder is defined as a hand with at least one improvement from baseline.

Question 1: I am happier with the overall appearance of my treated hand compared to my untreated hand
Question 2: My treated hand appears more attractive than my untreated hand
Question 3: My treated hand looks more youthful than my untreated hand
Question 4: My treated hand feels softer than my untreated hand
Question 5: The skin on my treated hand appears tighter than on my untreated hand
Question 6: My treated hand looks less bony than my untreated hand
Question 7: The veins on my treated hand are less apparent compared to my untreated hand
Question 8: My treated hand appears at least 5 years younger than my untreated hand
Question 9: My treated hand appears at least 10 years younger than my untreated hand
Question 10: The skin on my treated hand appears hydrated
Question 11: The treatment result looks natural
Question 12: I would recommend this treatment to a friend
Question 13: I would have another treatment to maintain these results

intervention.description: An injectable gel of Hyaluronic Acid and Lidocaine

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects willing to comply with the requirements of the study and providing a signed written informed consent including release of copyright of hand images.
- Males or females, 22 years of age or older
- Willing and able to perform hand functionality tests .
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- History of allergy or hypersensitivity to injectable HA gel or to gram positive bacterial proteins.
- History of allergy or hypersensitivity to lidocaine or other amide type anesthetics.
- Previous hand surgery including sclerotherapy, or history of hand trauma.
- Advanced photo aged/ photo damaged skin or skin condition with very crinkled or fragile skin on the dorsal hands.

group.title: All Subjects
group.description: Subjects randomized to treatment with Restylane Lyft with Lidocaine in one hand and no treatment in the other

group.title: Restylane Lyft With Lidocaine
group.description: Restylane Lyft with Lidocaine: An injectable gel of Hyaluronic Acid and Lidocaine; Subjects were randomized to receive Restylane Lyft with Lidocaine in either the right or left hand.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
FST II (Usually burns, tans with difficulty)
FST III (Sometimes mild burns, gradually tans)
FST IV (Rarely burns, tans with ease)
FST V (Very rarely burns, tans with ease)
FST VI (Never burns, tans very easily)

group.title: Restylane Lyft With Lidocaine

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
